meanings.definition: To drop (troops, equipment, etc.) by parachute.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers paradropped into the enemy territory.
meanings.sent2: The supplies were paradropped to the stranded hikers.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear paradropped from the top of the stairs, surprising the cat.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams paradropped into reality, bringing her joy.
meanings.sent5: The colorful parachutes paradropped gracefully from the sky.

meanings.sent1: The package paradropped safely into the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The skydiver paradropped from the plane with excitement.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cake paradropped onto the table, missing the candles.
meanings.sent4: His heart paradropped when he saw her smile from across the room.
meanings.sent5: The leaf paradropped gently to the ground, carried by the wind.
